contt: AAT results can be viewed on the Candidate Portal from 5:00 PM on September 17, 2022. Qualified candidates can fill their choices for Architecture programmes in IITs on the JoSAA portal from 6:00 PM on September 17, 2022.
Please click here to get the list of centres where the JEE (Advanced) 2022 Architecture Aptitude Test will be conducted.
The Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) portal for choice filling will be open from 10:00 AM on September 12, 2022. Click here to access the portal.
Please click here for the press release on JEE (Advanced) 2022.

To access the final answer keys for JEE (Advanced) 2022,  click here. Candidates can check their JEE (Advanced) 2022 result here from 10:00 AM IST on September 11, 2022. Qualified candidates can register for Architecture Aptitude Test (AAT) from September 11th, 2022, 10:00 AM IST to September 12th, 5:00 PM on the Candidate Portal.
To access the provisional answer keys for JEE (Advanced) 2022,  click here. Candidates can submit their feedback on these answer keys on the Candidate Portal till 17:00 IST on September 4, 2022.
Candidates who appeared in JEE (Advanced) 2022 can view their responses by logging into the Candidate Portal at https://cportal.jeeadv.ac.in from 10:00 AM on September 1, 2022.
The JEE (Advanced) 2022 question papers are available online now: Paper 1 and Paper 2.

Candidates who have successfully registered for JEE (Advanced) 2022 may download their admit cards from https://cportal.jeeadv.ac.in/ from 10:00 AM on August 23, 2022 until 9:00 AM on August 28, 2022.
The registration for JEE (Advanced) 2022 is closed. Candidates who have successfully completed Step 2 of the registration process MUST PAY the registration fee by 8:00 PM IST, August 13, 2022.

The deadline for JEE (Advanced) registration is extended till 8:00 PM IST, 12th August, 2022. This is the FINAL deadline, and students MUST UPLOAD their documents and exam city centre choices at https://jeeadv.nic.in by 8:00 PM today.
The JEE (Advanced) registration portal is open for eligible candidates to register.

The JEE (Advanced) registration portal will be open for eligible candidates to register from 20:00 IST on 8th August, 2022. Information on the revised schedule of important events is available on Important Dates.

Candidates who do not possess a
            valid OBC-NCL/EWS certificate issued after April 1, 2022
            must submit a declaration in lieu of the certificate. The
            declaration formats for both OBC-NCL and EWS are available
            here. Candidates can
            download the declaration fill it up and submit while
            registering for JEE (Advanced).
Foreign candidates who have appeared / are appearing for class XII abroad can register for JEE (Advanced) 2022 from 15:00 IST on August 1, 2022. Click here to register.
JEE (Advanced) 2022 is now scheduled to be held on Sunday, August 28,2022. The updated schedule and updated Information Brochure are now available.
The JEE (Advanced) 2022 Information Brochure, information for foreign candidates, and registration fees are now available on the website.
content: Information Brochureinformation for foreign candidatesregistration fees

contt: JEE (Advanced) 2022 will be conducted on Sunday, July 3, 2022. The complete schedule is available here.

Relaxation in eligibility criteria for candidates appearing in JEE (Advanced) 2022: Considering the COVID-19 pandemic situation in the country, the Joint Admission Board of JEE (Advanced), in the first JAB meeting held on December 14, 2021, has approved two one-time measures for candidates appearing in JEE (Advanced) 2022. Click here for details.
Website updates: The JEE (Advanced) 2022 website will be updated regularly as and when information becomes available.
The revised syllabus to be followed from JEE (Advanced) 2023 is available here.
